final_words: None. Shortly after the execution, his attorney read Elliott's handwritten statement: "In order to obtain my conviction and sentence of death, the Commonwealth assembled and presented a massive amount of false information. To all of the members of the Thrall and Finch facilities: I am deeply sorry that someone killed your loved ones," Elliott said, maintaining his innocence. He wrote that he hoped that the examination of the facts of his case will serve as "a launching pad" for the elimination of the death penalty and speculated that "God's purpose for my death is to demonstrate just how fractured our judicial system has become in regard to capital cases. The very system that I spent a lifetime defending has failed me." He signed the statement "God bless you. Bill."
